title: MySQL does not support the
FULL OUTER JOIN
c
, but there are ways to emulate one.

inline_content.Text: , but there are ways to emulate one.

title: What do we want to see?
b

inline_content.Text: What do we want to see?

title: We want to get a list, in which we see who owns which tools, and which tools might not have an owner.

inline_content.Text: We want to get a list, in which we see who owns which tools, and which tools might not have an owner.

title: To accomplish this, we can combine two queries by using
UNION
c
. In this first query we are joining the tools on the owners by using a
LEFT JOIN
c
. This will add all of our owners to our resultset, doesn’t matter if they actually own tools.

inline_content.Text: To accomplish this, we can combine two queries by using
. In this first query we are joining the tools on the owners by using a
. This will add all of our owners to our resultset, doesn’t matter if they actually own tools.

title: In the second query we are using a
RIGHT JOIN
c
to join the tools onto the owners. This way we manage to get all the tools in our resultset, if they are owned by no one their owner column will simply contain
NULL
c
. By adding a
WHERE
c
-clause which is filtering by
owners.owner_id IS NULL
c
we are defining the result as those datasets, which have not already been returned by the first query, as we are only looking for the data in the right joined table.

inline_content.Text: In the second query we are using a
to join the tools onto the owners. This way we manage to get all the tools in our resultset, if they are owned by no one their owner column will simply contain
we are defining the result as those datasets, which have not already been returned by the first query, as we are only looking for the data in the right joined table.

title: Since we are using
UNION ALL
c
the resultset of the second query will be attached to the first queries resultset.

inline_content.Text: the resultset of the second query will be attached to the first queries resultset.

title:
SELECT `owners`.`owner`, tools.tool
FROM `owners`
LEFT JOIN `tools` ON `owners`.`owner_id` = `tools`.`owner_id`
UNION ALL
SELECT `owners`.`owner`, tools.tool
FROM `owners`
RIGHT JOIN `tools` ON `owners`.`owner_id` = `tools`.`owner_id`
WHERE `owners`.`owner_id` IS NULL;

content_resolved.code:
SELECT `owners`.`owner`, tools.tool
FROM `owners`
LEFT JOIN `tools` ON `owners`.`owner_id` = `tools`.`owner_id`
UNION ALL
SELECT `owners`.`owner`, tools.tool
FROM `owners`
RIGHT JOIN `tools` ON `owners`.`owner_id` = `tools`.`owner_id`
WHERE `owners`.`owner_id` IS NULL;
